storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review schedule change requests to achieve informed approval decisions

testCases.title: Approve schedule change request successfully
preconditions: Approver account exists with valid credentials and approval permissions
At least one pending schedule change request is assigned to the approver
Request contains complete details and attachments
System is accessible and approval dashboard is functional
Database contains ScheduleChangeRequests and ApprovalActions tables with test data

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page and enter valid approver credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and redirected to the home page or approval dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard by clicking on 'Approvals' or 'Pending Requests' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays within 3 seconds showing a list of all pending schedule change requests assigned to the approver with columns for request ID, employee name, request date, and current status

steps.action: Select a specific pending schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying complete information including employee details, requested schedule changes, reason for change, submission date, and any attached supporting documents

steps.action: Review all request details and click on any attachments to view supporting documents
steps.expectedResult: Attachments open correctly in appropriate viewer (PDF, image, document) and display the complete content without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Approve' button to approve the schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: A confirmation dialog or comment box appears allowing the approver to add optional comments

steps.action: Enter optional approval comments in the comment field (e.g., 'Approved as requested. Schedule updated.') and click 'Submit' or 'Confirm Approval' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the approval action and displays a success message confirming the request has been approved

steps.action: Verify the request status has been updated by returning to the approval dashboard or refreshing the request details page
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Approved', the request is removed from pending list or marked as approved, and approval timestamp with approver name is recorded

steps.action: Verify that the requester receives a notification (check notification log or system notification panel)
steps.expectedResult: System sends notification to the requester indicating the schedule change request has been approved, including approver comments if provided

postconditions: Request status is permanently updated to 'Approved' in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Approval action is logged in ApprovalActions table with timestamp, approver ID, and comments
Requester has received notification of approval
Request no longer appears in pending requests list for the approver
Audit trail is complete with all approval details
Schedule change is ready for implementation

testCases.title: Reject schedule change request with comments
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid approval permissions
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Approver has access to the approval dashboard
System notification mechanism is configured and functional

steps.action: From the approval dashboard, locate and click on a pending schedule change request to review
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying complete information including employee name, requested changes, submission date, reason, and any attachments

steps.action: Review the request details and determine that the request should be rejected
steps.expectedResult: All request information is clearly visible and the 'Reject' button or option is available and enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Reject' button to initiate the rejection process
steps.expectedResult: A rejection dialog or form appears with a mandatory or optional comment field for entering the rejection reason

steps.action: Enter a detailed rejection reason in the comment field (e.g., 'Request conflicts with operational requirements. Insufficient staffing coverage during requested period.') and click 'Submit' or 'Confirm Rejection' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the rejection and displays a success message confirming the request has been rejected

steps.action: Verify the request status has been updated by checking the request details or returning to the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Rejected', rejection comments are saved and visible in the approval history, and timestamp with approver details is recorded

steps.action: Verify that the requester receives a rejection notification by checking the notification log or system records
steps.expectedResult: System sends notification to the requester containing the rejection status and the complete rejection reason provided by the approver

steps.action: As the requester (or verify in requester's view), check the notification received
steps.expectedResult: Notification clearly states the request was rejected and displays the rejection reason: 'Request conflicts with operational requirements. Insufficient staffing coverage during requested period.'

postconditions: Request status is updated to 'Rejected' in the database
Rejection comments are permanently saved in ApprovalActions table
Requester has received notification with rejection reason
Request is removed from pending list and moved to rejected requests
Complete audit trail exists with rejection details and timestamp
Requester can view rejection reason in their request history

testCases.title: Request additional information for schedule change request
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Pending schedule change request exists that requires additional information
System supports 'Request More Information' workflow status
Requester account is active and can receive notifications
Request resubmission functionality is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard and select a pending schedule change request to review
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing all available information about the schedule change request

steps.action: Review the request details and determine that additional information is needed to make an informed decision
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed but lack sufficient information for approval or rejection decision

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Request More Information' or 'Request Additional Info' button
steps.expectedResult: A form or dialog box appears with a comment field to specify what additional information is required

steps.action: Enter detailed comments specifying the required information (e.g., 'Please provide: 1) Coverage plan for your current shift, 2) Manager approval from your department, 3) Justification for urgency of this change') in the comment field
steps.expectedResult: Comment field accepts the text input and displays the entered information clearly

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Send Request' button to submit the information request
steps.expectedResult: System processes the action and displays a success message confirming that the information request has been sent to the requester

steps.action: Verify the request status has been updated by checking the request details or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Information Requested' or 'Pending Additional Info', and the request remains in the approver's queue with updated status indicator

steps.action: Verify that the requester receives a notification by checking notification logs or system records
steps.expectedResult: System sends notification to the requester indicating that additional information is required, including the complete list of requested details from the approver's comments

steps.action: As the requester (or simulate requester action), log into the system and navigate to 'My Requests' to view the request
steps.expectedResult: Request displays with status 'Information Requested' and shows the approver's comments detailing what additional information is needed

steps.action: As the requester, add the requested additional information by editing the request or adding attachments, then click 'Resubmit' or 'Update Request' button
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the updated information, changes request status back to 'Pending Review', and notifies the approver that additional information has been provided

steps.action: As the approver, verify that the updated request appears back in the pending requests queue with the new information
steps.expectedResult: Request reappears in approver's dashboard with updated status and timestamp, and the additional information provided by the requester is visible in the request details

postconditions: Request status is updated to reflect information was requested and subsequently provided
All comments and information requests are logged in ApprovalActions table with timestamps
Requester has successfully resubmitted the request with additional information
Request is back in approver's pending queue for final decision
Complete audit trail exists showing the information request cycle
Both approver and requester notifications have been sent and logged

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to track the status of my schedule change requests to achieve transparency and timely updates

testCases.title: View schedule change request status successfully
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid login credentials
Employee has previously submitted at least one schedule change request
Schedule change requests exist in various statuses (pending, approved, rejected)
System is accessible and 'My Requests' page is functional
Database contains employee's request history with approval actions and timestamps

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling portal login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the scheduling portal home page or dashboard

steps.action: Locate and click on the 'My Requests' menu option or navigation link
steps.expectedResult: System loads the 'My Requests' page within 2 seconds displaying a list of all schedule change requests submitted by the logged-in employee

steps.action: Review the list of schedule change requests displayed on the page
steps.expectedResult: List displays all employee's requests with columns showing request ID, submission date, requested change details, and current status (pending, approved, rejected, or info requested) with clear visual indicators for each status type

steps.action: Verify that status indicators are visually distinct (e.g., different colors or icons for pending, approved, rejected)
steps.expectedResult: Each status type has a clear visual indicator: pending (yellow/orange), approved (green), rejected (red), info requested (blue), making it easy to identify request status at a glance

steps.action: Select a specific schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying complete information including requested schedule changes, submission date, current status, and reason for request

steps.action: Scroll down or navigate to the approval history section of the request details
steps.expectedResult: Detailed approval history is displayed showing all approval actions taken on the request, including action type (submitted, reviewed, approved/rejected), approver name, timestamp for each action, and any comments provided by approvers

steps.action: Verify the timestamps are displayed in a readable format and are chronologically ordered
steps.expectedResult: All timestamps are displayed in clear date-time format (e.g., 'MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM AM/PM'), listed in chronological order from oldest to newest action

steps.action: Check if any approver comments are present in the approval history
steps.expectedResult: If approver added comments (approval notes, rejection reasons, or information requests), they are displayed clearly alongside the corresponding approval action with full text visible

steps.action: Return to 'My Requests' list and verify that the status shown in the list matches the detailed status viewed
steps.expectedResult: Status displayed in the list view is consistent with the detailed status shown in the request details page, confirming real-time accuracy

postconditions: Employee has successfully viewed all their schedule change requests
Employee has accessed detailed approval history for at least one request
No unauthorized access to other employees' requests occurred
System performance met the 2-second response time requirement
All status information displayed accurately reflects current database state
Employee session remains active and secure

testCases.title: Prevent employee from viewing others' requests
preconditions: Employee is logged into the scheduling portal with valid credentials
Multiple employees exist in the system with their own schedule change requests
Another employee's request ID is known or can be obtained
System has role-based access control implemented
Security validation is active on API endpoints

steps.action: As the logged-in employee, navigate to 'My Requests' page and note the URL structure and request IDs visible
steps.expectedResult: Employee can view their own requests normally, and URL structure is visible (e.g., '/my-requests' or '/requests?employeeId=123')

steps.action: Identify or obtain a request ID that belongs to another employee (e.g., request ID 9999 that is not in the employee's list)
steps.expectedResult: Another employee's request ID is identified for testing purposes

steps.action: Attempt to access another employee's request by manually modifying the URL in the browser address bar (e.g., change '/request/1234' to '/request/9999' or modify employeeId parameter)
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt and denies access to the request

steps.action: Observe the system response after attempting unauthorized access
steps.expectedResult: System displays an error message such as 'Access Denied', 'Unauthorized Access', or 'You do not have permission to view this request', and does not display any details of the other employee's request

steps.action: Verify that the employee is redirected back to their 'My Requests' page or an error page, and no sensitive information about the other employee's request is exposed
steps.expectedResult: Employee is redirected to a safe page (their own requests list or error page), and no data about the unauthorized request is visible in the response, page source, or network traffic

steps.action: Attempt to access another employee's request using API endpoint directly (e.g., using browser developer tools or API testing tool to call GET /api/my-schedule-change-requests with another employee's request ID)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code with appropriate error message, and does not return any request data

steps.action: Return to 'My Requests' page using normal navigation (clicking menu link)
steps.expectedResult: Employee can access their own 'My Requests' page normally without any issues

steps.action: Select and view one of the employee's own requests from the list
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted immediately, and full request details including approval history, timestamps, and comments are displayed without any errors or access restrictions

steps.action: Verify that the security event was logged by checking system logs (if accessible) or confirming with system administrator
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized access attempt is logged in security audit logs with timestamp, employee ID, and attempted request ID for security monitoring purposes

postconditions: Employee was successfully prevented from accessing another employee's request
No unauthorized data was exposed or accessible
Employee can still access their own requests without restriction
Security controls are confirmed to be functioning correctly
Unauthorized access attempt is logged in audit trail
System maintains data privacy and security compliance

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to configure approval workflow rules to achieve flexible and compliant schedule change approvals

testCases.title: Create and activate a new approval workflow
preconditions: Administrator account with valid credentials exists
Administrator has proper role permissions for workflow configuration
Admin portal is accessible and operational
At least one role, department, and individual user exists in the system for approver assignment
ApprovalWorkflows and ApproverAssignments tables are accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the admin portal login page and enter valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and redirected to the admin portal dashboard

steps.action: Locate and click on the workflow configuration section in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration page is displayed showing existing workflows and option to create new workflow

steps.action: Click on 'Create New Workflow' button
steps.expectedResult: New workflow creation form is displayed with fields for workflow name, description, and approval stages

steps.action: Enter workflow name as 'Multi-Level Schedule Approval' and description as 'Three-stage approval process for schedule changes'
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name and description are accepted and displayed in the form fields

steps.action: Add first approval stage named 'Manager Review' and assign approver by role 'Department Manager'
steps.expectedResult: First approval stage is created with role-based approver assignment successfully configured

steps.action: Add second approval stage named 'HR Review' and assign approver by department 'Human Resources'
steps.expectedResult: Second approval stage is created with department-based approver assignment successfully configured

steps.action: Add third approval stage named 'Executive Approval' and assign specific individual approver 'John Smith - VP Operations'
steps.expectedResult: Third approval stage is created with individual approver assignment successfully configured

steps.action: Click 'Save Workflow' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the workflow configuration, displays success message 'Workflow saved successfully', and workflow appears in the list with 'Inactive' status

steps.action: Locate the newly created workflow in the list and click 'Activate' button
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to activate this workflow?'

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' on the activation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Workflow status changes to 'Active', success message displays 'Workflow activated successfully', and workflow becomes available for new schedule change requests

steps.action: Submit a new schedule change request that should trigger this workflow
steps.expectedResult: The newly activated workflow is applied to the schedule change request and first stage approver receives assignment

postconditions: New approval workflow is created and saved in ApprovalWorkflows table
Workflow status is set to 'Active'
All three approval stages are configured with assigned approvers in ApproverAssignments table
Workflow is available for routing new schedule change requests
Changes are applied within 1 minute as per performance requirements
Administrator remains logged into the admin portal

testCases.title: Prevent invalid workflow configurations
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the admin portal
Administrator has proper role permissions for workflow configuration
Workflow configuration page is accessible
System validation rules are active and enforced

steps.action: Navigate to workflow configuration page and click 'Create New Workflow' button
steps.expectedResult: New workflow creation form is displayed

steps.action: Enter workflow name as 'Incomplete Workflow Test' and description
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name and description are accepted in the form

steps.action: Add first approval stage named 'Initial Review' but leave the approver assignment field empty
steps.expectedResult: Approval stage is added with no approver assigned

steps.action: Add second approval stage named 'Final Review' but leave the approver assignment field empty
steps.expectedResult: Second approval stage is added with no approver assigned

steps.action: Click 'Save Workflow' button without assigning any approvers
steps.expectedResult: System performs validation and displays error messages: 'Approval stage 1 requires at least one approver' and 'Approval stage 2 requires at least one approver'. Workflow is not saved

steps.action: Verify that the workflow does not appear in the workflow list
steps.expectedResult: Workflow list does not contain the invalid workflow, confirming save was prevented

steps.action: Return to the workflow form and assign approver by role 'Team Lead' to the first approval stage
steps.expectedResult: First approval stage now has valid approver assignment, error for stage 1 is cleared

steps.action: Assign approver by department 'Finance' to the second approval stage
steps.expectedResult: Second approval stage now has valid approver assignment, error for stage 2 is cleared

steps.action: Click 'Save Workflow' button with all required approvers assigned
steps.expectedResult: System validates successfully, displays success message 'Workflow saved successfully', and workflow appears in the list with all validation errors resolved

postconditions: Invalid workflow configuration was prevented from being saved
Validation errors were displayed to guide administrator
Corrected workflow is successfully saved in ApprovalWorkflows table
Data integrity is maintained with no incomplete workflows in the system
Administrator remains on workflow configuration page

testCases.title: Restrict workflow configuration access to administrators
preconditions: Non-admin user account exists with valid credentials and standard user role
Administrator account exists with valid credentials and admin role
Workflow configuration page requires admin role for access
Role-based access control is properly configured
Both users are not currently logged in

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page using non-admin user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid non-admin user credentials and click 'Login'
steps.expectedResult: Non-admin user is successfully authenticated and redirected to standard user dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate directly to the workflow configuration page URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access this page. Administrator privileges required.' User is redirected to unauthorized access page or remains on current page

steps.action: Verify that workflow configuration menu option is not visible in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration option is not displayed in the navigation menu for non-admin user

steps.action: Log out from the non-admin user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Enter valid administrator credentials and click 'Login'
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and redirected to admin portal dashboard

steps.action: Locate workflow configuration option in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration menu option is visible and accessible to administrator

steps.action: Click on workflow configuration menu option
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and workflow configuration page is displayed with full functionality including create, edit, delete, and activate options

steps.action: Verify all workflow management features are available: create new workflow, edit existing workflow, delete workflow, and activate/deactivate workflow
steps.expectedResult: All workflow management features are accessible and functional for administrator user

postconditions: Non-admin user access to workflow configuration was successfully blocked
Appropriate error message was displayed to non-admin user
Administrator successfully accessed workflow configuration with full permissions
Role-based access control is confirmed to be working correctly
Security requirements are met with admin-only access enforced
Administrator remains logged into the admin portal

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to receive notifications for pending schedule change requests to achieve timely processing

testCases.title: Verify notification sent upon request assignment
preconditions: Approver account exists with valid email address and active status
Approver has default notification preferences enabled for both email and in-app notifications
Active approval workflow is configured with the approver assigned
Notification service is operational and integrated
Employee account exists to submit schedule change request
ScheduleChangeRequests and ApprovalWorkflows tables are accessible
Notification delivery logging is enabled

steps.action: Log in as employee user and navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Fill in schedule change request details: select date, enter reason 'Medical appointment', and specify requested time change from 9:00 AM to 11:00 AM
steps.expectedResult: All request details are entered successfully in the form

steps.action: Click 'Submit Request' button
steps.expectedResult: Request is submitted successfully, confirmation message displays 'Your schedule change request has been submitted', and request is saved in ScheduleChangeRequests table

steps.action: System automatically determines approver based on configured workflow and assigns the request
steps.expectedResult: Request is assigned to the designated approver within the workflow, assignment is recorded in the system

steps.action: Wait up to 1 minute and verify notification is triggered and sent to the assigned approver
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to approver via both email and in-app notification within 1 minute of assignment as per SLA

steps.action: Log in as the assigned approver and check email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received with subject line 'New Schedule Change Request Requires Your Approval' containing request ID, employee name, requested date, reason, and direct link to approval interface

steps.action: Verify in-app notification by checking notification center in the application
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed showing 'New schedule change request from [Employee Name] requires your review' with request summary and timestamp

steps.action: Review notification content for accuracy: verify request ID, employee name, date, time change details, and reason match the submitted request
steps.expectedResult: All notification content is accurate and matches the original schedule change request details

steps.action: Click on the direct link provided in the email notification
steps.expectedResult: Browser opens and approver is directed to the approval interface with the specific schedule change request displayed for review

steps.action: Verify the correct request is displayed with all details: employee name, current schedule, requested schedule, reason, and submission date
steps.expectedResult: Approval interface displays the correct request with complete and accurate information, approve and deny buttons are available

steps.action: Check notification delivery logs in the admin system
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery status is logged showing successful delivery timestamp, recipient, notification type (email and in-app), and delivery confirmation

postconditions: Schedule change request is successfully submitted and assigned to approver
Notification is sent to approver within 1 minute SLA
Both email and in-app notifications are delivered successfully
Notification content is accurate and actionable
Direct link navigates approver to correct request
Notification delivery is logged for audit purposes
Request remains in pending status awaiting approval
Approver has access to review and act on the request

testCases.title: Test notification preference settings
preconditions: Approver account exists and is active
Approver is currently receiving both email and in-app notifications (default settings)
Approver profile page with notification preferences is accessible
Active approval workflow is configured with the approver assigned
Employee account exists to submit schedule change request
Notification service is operational

steps.action: Log in as approver and navigate to user profile settings page
steps.expectedResult: Profile settings page is displayed with personal information and notification preferences section

steps.action: Locate notification preferences section and view current settings
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences section shows current settings with checkboxes for 'Email Notifications' (checked) and 'In-App Notifications' (checked)

steps.action: Uncheck the 'Email Notifications' checkbox to disable email alerts while keeping 'In-App Notifications' enabled
steps.expectedResult: Email Notifications checkbox is unchecked, In-App Notifications remains checked

steps.action: Click 'Save Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message displays 'Notification preferences updated successfully', and changes are saved to approver profile in the database

steps.action: Verify updated preferences are displayed correctly after save
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences show Email Notifications disabled (unchecked) and In-App Notifications enabled (checked)

steps.action: Log out from approver account
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully logged out

steps.action: Log in as employee user and navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed

steps.action: Submit a new schedule change request with details: date tomorrow, reason 'Personal appointment', time change from 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM
steps.expectedResult: Request is submitted successfully and assigned to the approver based on workflow

steps.action: Wait up to 1 minute for notification processing
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request assignment and triggers notification based on approver preferences

steps.action: Check approver's email inbox for notification
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received, confirming email alerts are disabled as per updated preferences

steps.action: Log in as approver and check in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed showing the new schedule change request, confirming in-app notifications are still active

steps.action: Verify notification delivery logs show only in-app notification was sent
steps.expectedResult: Logs confirm in-app notification was delivered successfully and no email notification was sent, respecting approver preferences

postconditions: Approver notification preferences are successfully updated and saved
Email notifications are disabled for the approver
In-app notifications remain enabled and functional
New schedule change request triggers only in-app notification
No email notification is sent to approver
Notification preferences are respected by the system
Notification delivery logs accurately reflect preference-based delivery
Request remains pending and accessible to approver for review

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to delegate approval tasks to another approver to achieve continuity during absence

testCases.title: Assign and revoke delegation successfully
preconditions: User with approver role is logged into the system
At least one other approver exists in the system to be assigned as delegate
Approver has active approval tasks in their queue
DelegationAssignments table is accessible
API endpoints POST /api/delegations and GET /api/delegations are operational

steps.action: Navigate to delegation settings page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Delegation settings page loads successfully displaying delegation management interface

steps.action: Click on 'Assign Delegate' or 'Create Delegation' button
steps.expectedResult: Delegation assignment form is displayed with fields for delegate selection, start date, and end date

steps.action: Select a valid approver from the delegate dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Selected approver name is populated in the delegate field

steps.action: Set start date to current date and end date to 7 days from current date
steps.expectedResult: Both dates are accepted and displayed in the form with proper date format

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Assign Delegation' button
steps.expectedResult: Delegation is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and delegation appears in the delegation list with status 'Active'

steps.action: Verify delegate receives notification about the delegation assignment
steps.expectedResult: Delegate receives notification indicating they have been assigned approval tasks with delegation period details

steps.action: Log out from the original approver account and log in as the delegate
steps.expectedResult: Delegate successfully logs into the system

steps.action: Navigate to approval requests queue or delegated tasks section
steps.expectedResult: Delegate can see the delegated approval requests from the original approver in their queue

steps.action: Select one of the delegated approval requests and click 'Approve'
steps.expectedResult: Delegate can successfully approve the request, approval is processed, and request status changes to 'Approved'

steps.action: Log out from delegate account and log back in as the original approver
steps.expectedResult: Original approver successfully logs back into the system

steps.action: Navigate to delegation settings and locate the active delegation assignment
steps.expectedResult: Active delegation is displayed in the delegation list with current status and delegate information

steps.action: Click 'Revoke' or 'Cancel Delegation' button for the active delegation
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking to confirm revocation of delegation

steps.action: Confirm the revocation action
steps.expectedResult: Delegation is removed successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and delegation status changes to 'Revoked' in the audit log

steps.action: Log out and log back in as the delegate, then navigate to approval requests
steps.expectedResult: Delegate no longer has access to the previously delegated approval tasks, and delegated requests are removed from their queue

postconditions: Delegation assignment is revoked and recorded in audit logs
Delegate no longer has access to original approver's tasks
Original approver retains full control of their approval tasks
Delegation history is maintained in DelegationAssignments table with revocation timestamp
All approval actions taken by delegate during delegation period remain valid and recorded

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized delegation assignment
preconditions: User without approver role is logged into the system
User has standard or non-approver permissions
Delegation functionality is enabled in the system
Security controls are properly configured to restrict delegation assignment to approvers only

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to delegation settings page by entering the URL directly or through navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access delegation settings' or redirects to unauthorized access page

steps.action: Attempt to send a POST request to /api/delegations endpoint with delegation assignment data using API testing tool or browser console
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden status code with error message 'Unauthorized: Only approvers can assign delegations'

steps.action: Verify that no delegation assignment is created in the DelegationAssignments table
steps.expectedResult: No new delegation record is created, and database remains unchanged

steps.action: Check system audit logs for the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Audit log records the unauthorized delegation assignment attempt with user details, timestamp, and action denied status

postconditions: No delegation assignment is created in the system
Non-approver user remains restricted from delegation functionality
Security violation is logged in audit trail
System security controls remain intact and functional
